meanings.definition: The state of being scarce or in short supply.
meanings.sent1: During the drought, there were scarcities of water in the village.
meanings.sent2: The scarcities of food in the winter made it difficult for the animals to find enough to eat.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a fun adventure when they discovered scarcities of snacks in the basket.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, time seemed to be the scarcest resource among all scarcities.
meanings.sent5: The explorer faced scarcities of supplies as he ventured deeper into the unknown jungle.

meanings.sent1: The store experienced scarcities of toys during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: There were scarcities of volunteers for the charity event, so they had to work extra hard.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick went wrong when there were scarcities of rabbits for the hat.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the player strategically created scarcities of pawns to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent5: The chef improvised a new dish due to scarcities of ingredients in the kitchen.
